alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex and northern Mathews Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blakes, or near Gloucester Courthouse. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Blakes around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Dutton, Cobbs Creek, Hudgins, Wilton, Amburg, Stampers, Wake, Hardyville, Ware Neck and Fort Nonsense. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
